result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emanuel Saavedra

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Emanuel Saavedra in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Emanuel Saavedra.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for a final pre-trial. Amended complaint filed. Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. Court found probable cause. Jury trial date rescheduled due to a scheduling error on the Court's end. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defense Notice of Motion & Motion In Limine (Prior Convictions, 911 Calls, Testimonial Statements of Non Appearing Witnesses), filed.

Defendant Emanuel Saavedra in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
for Leave to File Amended Complaint, received and filed.

Defendant Emanuel Saavedra in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Emanuel Saavedra appeared by video means with Attorney. State is considering filing an amended complaint. Court ordered any amended complaint be filed by 6/30/2022.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Emanuel Saavedra in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Joel Rosenthal to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $75.00 per month beginning on 10/1/2022  and then the 1st of each month there after.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.
*
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Emanuel Saavedra in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
Defendant advises the Court he has been unsucessful in hiring private counsel. Court orders matter set for indigency hearing, in person. 
Court orders matter adjourned back to Branch 37.  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Emanuel Saavedra in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/22/2022 @ 2:00pm
